privacy.introText1: We take the protection of your personal data very seriously. This privacy policy explains what information we collect, how we use it, and your rights regarding your personal data.
privacy.introText2: This privacy policy applies to all services provided by Protest Listing and complies with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and applicable data protection laws.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.metaDescription: Terms of Service governing how to use Protest Listing, the open directory for protests and demonstrations.
terms.subtitle: These terms explain how to use Protest Listing and outline the responsibilities that keep the directory trustworthy.

contact.title: Contact
contact.intro: If you have questions about these terms, please contact us by email:

platformPurpose.title: Platform Purpose
paragraphs: Protest Listing is a volunteer civic-tech project maintained by a small team. We aggregate upcoming demonstrations from public data sources and vetted community submissions so people can plan civic participation more easily.
We may adapt or pause features over time in order to keep the dataset trustworthy and the moderation workflow manageable.

accountResponsibilities.title: Account Responsibilities
paragraphs: By registering you confirm that you meet the minimum legal age in your region and that the email address you provide is yours.
Keep your credentials private, update your contact details when they change, and let us know if you suspect unauthorised access.
list: Use a strong, unique password for your account.
Limit yourself to one account per person unless we explicitly approve otherwise.
Respond to moderator requests in a timely, respectful manner.

communitySubmissions.title: Community Submissions
paragraphs: You can submit new events or corrections. Share details that are accurate to the best of your knowledge and cite public references wherever possible.
Avoid uploading personal data that has not already been publicly disclosed by the organiser or is not required by law.
list: Provide source links or context that helps moderators verify the submission.
Stick to factual descriptions and avoid promotional or partisan slogans.
Respect sensitive locations and vulnerable communities when sharing map pins.

moderation.title: Moderation & Verification
paragraphs: Moderators review every community submission before it is published.
Repeated attempts to spread misinformation or otherwise abuse the workflow can lead to account suspension. You can appeal moderation decisions via the contact email below.

acceptableUse.title: Acceptable Use
paragraphs: Help us keep Protest Listing constructive. The following behaviour is not allowed:
list: Impersonating other contributors or misrepresenting your affiliation.
Harassing organisers, moderators, or other users.
Automating interactions in ways that degrade service availability.
Using the platform to plan unlawful activity or incite violence.

dataApi.title: Open Data & API Usage
paragraphs: The scraper service exposes a public REST API. You are welcome to build tools or analyses on top of it provided you respect published rate limits, keep source attributions intact, and link back to Protest Listing when sharing results.
Bulk re-publication or commercial resale of the aggregated dataset requires prior written permission. See the scraper project documentation for endpoint details and export formats.

emailVerification.title: Email Verification
paragraphs: A verified email address is required before you can submit or moderate events. We currently send only verification codes and security-related recovery emails.

termination.title: Termination
paragraphs: We may suspend or delete accounts that violate these terms, threaten platform integrity, or ignore moderator requests. You can ask us to remove your account at any time; we may keep minimal audit logs to comply with legal requirements or prevent abuse.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer & Liability
paragraphs: Event schedules can change at short notice. We provide the directory "as is" without warranties of completeness or accuracy. Always double-check with organisers before travelling.
To the maximum extent permitted by law, we are not liable for losses that arise from using—or being unable to use—Protest Listing.

changes.title: Changes to These Terms
paragraphs: We may update these terms when we ship new functionality, respond to legal requirements, or incorporate community feedback. Significant updates will be announced on the site and continued use after publication constitutes acceptance.

about.metaDescription: Learn how Protest Listing centralizes protest information and how you can contribute.
about.title: About
about.heroSubtitle: A collaborative open-source platform to centralize and normalize information about upcoming protests and demonstrations.

mission.title: Our mission
paragraphs: We believe that information about civic engagement opportunities should be easily accessible to everyone. Unfortunately, protest and demonstration details are often scattered across hard-to-reach corners of the internet, making it difficult for people to stay informed.

This platform was born from the frustration of trying to find a centralized list of upcoming protests. What should be simple public information felt deliberately difficult to access. We want to change that by creating an open, collaborative solution that aggregates and normalizes data from many sources.

how.title: How it works
how.intro: Our platform combines automated data collection with community contributions to provide comprehensive protest listings:

automation.title: Automated scraping
automation.description: We automatically collect event data from official sources such as police registrations, city portals, and established organizations to ensure broad coverage.

community.title: Community contributions
community.description: Registered users can submit missing events while moderators verify submissions to maintain data quality and prevent misinformation.

sources.title: Current data sources
sources.intro: We currently aggregate data from these trusted sources, with more being added regularly:

comingSoon.title: Coming soon
comingSoon.intro: We are continuously improving the platform with new features:

items.title: Data export & downloads
items.description: Export filtered event data in CSV, JSON, or ICS formats.

items.title: Subscribable calendars
items.description: Custom ICS feeds for specific time ranges and filters.

items.title: Advanced filtering
items.description: More detailed search options and categorisation.

items.title: Contact form
items.description: An easy way to suggest new sources and share feedback.

items.title: User registration system
items.description: Allow community members to manually add missing events.

developers.title: For developers & contributors
developers.intro: This is an open-source project and we welcome contributions from developers who share our vision of accessible civic information:
developers.apiDescription: Our REST API provides programmatic access to protest data with comprehensive filtering options:
developers.apiFilters: Filter by city, country, date range, geolocation, source, language, and more.
developers.apiMore: Export data in JSON, CSV, or subscribable ICS formats—perfect for building your own applications or integrations.
developers.cta: Want to help? Open an issue or submit a pull request on GitHub.

openSource.title: Free & open source forever
paragraphs: This project is and will always remain completely free and open source. Access to civic engagement information should never hide behind paywalls or proprietary systems.

Licensed under AGPL-3.0, our codebase is transparent, auditable, and built to benefit the entire community. Whether you are a citizen looking for local events or a developer extending the project, you are welcome here.

contact.title: Get involved
contact.intro: We would love to hear from you! Whether you have suggestions for new data sources, found a bug, or want to contribute code:

sections.title: General inquiries
sections.description: For suggestions about new sources to scrape or general feedback, use our contact form.

sections.title: Technical issues
sections.description: Found a bug or have a feature request? Report it via our contact form or open an issue on GitHub.

important.title: Important information
paragraphs: This platform aggregates protest information from public sources and user submissions. While we strive for accuracy, we cannot guarantee the completeness or correctness of all listings.
Please verify event details independently before attending. We are not the organisers of listed events and do not endorse specific political views—we simply make civic information easier to access.
